definition: lit. to guard a tree-stump, waiting for rabbits (idiom)/to wait idly for opportunities/to trust to chance rather than show initiative
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
tree trunk/stump (tree root)/a plant/classifier for trees or plants/strain (biology)/to involve others (in shady business)
to stay
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
rabbit
to guard a tree-stump, waiting for rabbits, and climb a tree to catch fish (idiom); without any practical course of action
pinyin: shou3 zhu1 dai4 tu4 , yuan2 mu4 qiu2 yu2

sentences.english: Finally, there is no way in the circumstances, only waiting for parents to go home.
sentences.chinese: 最後在沒有辦法的情況下，只有讓家長回家守株待兔。

sentences.english: Sylar: We're just gonna wait for him to come after us.
sentences.chinese: 我們只要守株待兔，等着他來複仇好了。

definition: to walk right into the trap
to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
lit. a crafty rabbit has three burrows/a sly individual has more than one plan to fall back on (idiom)
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2

definition: to prepare an ambush/to waylay
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
to follow sb/to tail/to shadow
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to ambush/to lie in wait for/to lie low/ambush
